results.title: Suddenly you're a parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Looks at the birth of a baby, examines the new born’s reflex abilities, and discusses the importance of movement and touch. The premature birth is also discussed.

results.title: The Single Parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
P.G.R. starts this topic by talking with a group of people about how they became single parents, and how they coped during the early stages. We then examine the problems of being a single parent, including household and financial management, helping children through this difficult period of their lives, and sharing the responsibility for the care of the kids. Finally, our guests reflect on their experiences, discussing the hardships and what they have gained as single parents.

Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
We provide advice on how to look after sick kids at home, and how to approach to approach some of the problems and questions that arise and questions that arise.

Episode of Series “PGR Series”.

results.title: Health Hints
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR looks at the First Aid kit, and what extra items are required when there are children in the house. We also show what to do in the event of a nose bleed or a tooth being knocked out. How childhood asthma affects children and their parents is also examined, with the support of the Asthma Foundation. Paula talks with a vet about the value of pets to children, and they discuss proper pet care procedures. Colin looks at the effects of poor co-ordination on young children, what parents need to watch for, and how training programs for clumsy children can make a big difference to their lives. It also includes an easy to remember guide on how to react to all first aid situations.

results.title: The First few months
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Parents are likely to encounter some problems during the first few months after the birth of their child. These problems include meeting the needs of demanding babies, coping with an unsettled baby, maintaining support when tired and irritable, and simply finding some peace and quiet. Relaxation techniques are discussed, ways to handle babies are demonstrated and preparations for “baby’s” first venture “outside” by car, travel, etc are also discussed.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Peter Lindon, Norman Athersmith and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Five short segments cover a range of physical education activities from babyhood to late primary age. Includes segments on kindergym, eurythmics, the Lady George Kindergarten and on creative dance.

results.title: Feeding
results.creator_credit: Chris Farrell, Norman Athersmith, Margot Phillipson and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Five 10 minute programs as screened on ABC television giving advice for parents on the feeding of young children. Discusses breast and bottle feeding, weaning, the introduction of solid foods and general aspects of nutrition.

results.title: Safety II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
A large number of small children and babies are injured every year in and around the home. These 5 short episodes look at child safety in a practical way. Focuses on issues such as common, easily swallowed poisons, burns, fire-proof clothing, the dangers of electricity, devices which can be installed to prevent electrical accidents, the hazards to be found in the backyard, the safe placement of furniture and fittings in the home, pool safety and rescusitation skills in case of drowning.
